text:
How: Bottle.
Where: Sweet & Sour 2016.
Appearance: Hazy brown colour with a minimal head.
Aroma: Oak, raspberries, tart, vinous, raisin.
Body: Light to medium body, low to medium carbonation.
Flavour: Fruit, tart, sour, raspberries, raisin, vinegar, vinous.
Bottle. Pours murky dark amber with a small head. Aroma is fruity dank funky sour wood slight sweetness. Flavor is sour funky lemon juice vinegary astringent. Right in my alley.

August 20, 2016. Bottle at Sweet & Sour, vintage 2014, thanks for sharing! 
Murky red/brownish with a small tan head. Aroma is fruity and funky with raspberries, some plums, hints of balsamico, toffee, g3ape skins, and that typical SARA funk in the background. 
Taste is quite sour and fruity. Finish is sour and dry with acetic acid, lemon juice, raspberries, minerals and oak. Light bodied, dry texture, light carbonation. 
Nice aroma, a bit too sour finish.

Bottle at Sweet & Sour 2016 at Sahtipaja, Sätila. Cloudy copper/brown color with a nice beige head. Tart raspberry aroma, wild strawberries, woody, vinous, raisins, floral notes, red grapes, some hay. Tart woody raspberry flavor, grapes, vinous, red grapes, raisins, vinegar notes. Great beer.
A: Brown/orange coloured with a white head that dissapates fast. N: Oak, funk, raspberry, cherries T: Raspberry, oak, funk, minerals O: Very nice and tart! Complex flavours!

750 ml bottle shared by joet at RBHQ - thanks again, Joe! 2014 vintage. Pours a cloudy reddish amber with a small off-white head that settles into a ring. Notes of tart and sweet raspberries, plums, oak, florals, lemon, vanilla, lychee, faint minerals, and nectarine. Medium-bodied, with medium carbonation and a tart, fruity mouthfeel. Nice complexity. Excellent sour brown.

Bottle - Soured nice malts, vinous vinegar. Clearish gold copper with a decent light white head. Nice soured malyts, touch of vinegar and cherry notes. Nice tart and a bit of a dry finish. Balanced sweet and tart.

Bottle shared at Casa de Jose during RBWG 2016. Pours clear copper-red with a slight, creamy off-white head. The nose has nice leathery tart berries, hints of acetic acid. Light sweet flavor with pleasant dried out, tart and leathery berries, a little woody dryness, some earth, citrus. Light to medium bodied with fine carbonation. Crisp, dry and fairly refreshing on the finish, with relaxed acetic bite, more tart berries. Great balance, nuance. Wonderful stuff.

Bottle split at and big thanks to Joe T, 04/02/16.
Rich reddish amber with a moderately appointed light beige swirl.
Nose is funky red berry, straw, tarte berry, raspberry tarte, straw, barnyard, wood must. 
Taste comprises damp wood, cherry skins, tangy berry, fruit balsams, wood must, vanilla oak.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, tarte funky berry finale with rising acidity and a puckering curtain call.
Solid.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle shared by joet, thanks! Lightly hazy deep red pour with thin white head. Aroma is very very fruity, light, lemony notes, citric, light winey notes. Taste is super tart, very fruity, dry tart finish. Palate is med bodied with light carbonation. Very good.

Bottle at RBWG 2016. Thanks JoeT! Nose is moderate fruity esters and from fruit. Some light balsamic notes. Inviting. Deep red. Small white head. Taste is a wonderful puckering berry flavor. Drying in the finish. Very pleasant citrus undertones. Light malty character. Really good.

Bottle at JoeT?s cat cabana. Thanks RateBeer CEO. Light hazy amber liquid with medium off-white head. Aroma of lemon, apple skin, raspberries, mango, red berries, wood, lychee and light grain. Taste is very light sweet and medium sour with notes of lemon, mango, lychee, red berries, apple skin and mineral. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Wow. This is great. Very complex.

The beer is reddish brown in color. Small off white head. Big raspberry aroma. Mild funk and lemons. A little bit of vinegar. Medium tart. Big on raspberries. Some oak. Some stone fruit. A little stronger than Id like.

A - the pour is a nice rosy copper mahogany with a small ring of off white head. S - the raspberries (both seedy and underripe and jammy) lead the way. Nice combo of an earthy, oaky, tannins, leathery, black cherries and currents red wine. Notes of red wine vinegar, balsamic vinegar and acrid sharp lemony notes. M - sour up front to a malt heavy full body. End is a quick sharp stinging vinegar to a sweet dry end. T - nice combo of framboise and sour brown. Seedy underripe raspberries and sweet jammy notes lead the taste. Palate is earthy buttery oaky tannin-y leathery tobacco currents black cherries red wine followed by vinegar and malts. Balsamic and ride wine vinegar blend with darker malty palate. End has a short sharp lemony acidity to assert dry fruitiness. O - super complex and probably the best sour brown I've had. An interesting departure from santes norm. A little less on the brown and acidity would have ruffled my skirt a little more, but I'm being picky because this is an great beer that I have to struggle to find fault. Not my favorite style but still spot on. 4.2

750ml bottle, reviewed from notes (5/31/14 and 9/7/14). Aroma is dominated by raspberry and blackberry jam with some kind of funky red-wine-vinous-oak tannin. There is an obvious malt presence to the tune of dark caramel and toasted bread as ineedbeer pointed out. The beer pours deep mahogany with big white head that turns into a ring and some carbonation spots on top of the liquid. Taste is up front sour raspberry, with faint caramel. The jam sweetness takes over mid-palate and really brings out ripe berries and light lemon/citrus. The body is medium-full with medium carbonation and a semi-dry, sour finish. After taste is seedy berry, bread crusts and oak spice. The beauty behind this beer is how jammy and sour it is without bringing out the syrup texture, or vinegar/acetic quality some misguided sours tend to have. Even with 3 months age on the bottle after first exposure the raspberry jam quality still held up, but with a more complex funk character. Beautiful beer. Perhaps my favorite Sante Adairius sour to date - which means I have to rate it higher than West Ashley.

Aroma is rather fruity with quite a bit of raspberry character. Some light malt notes of caramel and toasted bread. Low acidity in the aroma. Some cherry and other berry notes. Pours a cloudy, burnt amber brown with a small, moderately thick, tan head with decent retention. Small lacing and faint legs. Flavor is very acidic with some nice berry, cherry and cassis notes. Light citrus notes and a touch of acetic character. Medium light bitterness and light oak notes. Light malt notes of toasted bread and dark caramel with faint chocolate. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation. Low astringency and low alcohol alcohol warmth. Overall, a pretty nice fruited sour beer. Lots of fruit notes in the aroma and decent notes in the flavor. Acidity is high but not over the top.

My 100th Sante rating! What a ludicrous array of sublime beers it has been. This is no exception, with the aroma bursting right out of the bottleneck. The purplish amber liquid emanates the essence of wild black raspberries and Concord grapes with a jammy end. Flavor emphasizes the raspberry, with the acidic bite of unripe Himalayan blackberries. Quite sour, mostly lactic plus a lemon juice intensity on the finish. All throughout, theres an understated malt note, like an unsweetened chocolate cake donut. Totally great!

Bottle, shared among friends, thanks! Pours cloudy reddish chestnut with a small tan head that dissipates quickly leaving good lacing. Aroma is very raspberry jammy, some faint funky notes, a bit of dark sugar, oak tannins. Flavor is kinda sweet and just a bit tart, lots and lots of raspberry in this one, jammy and yummy with a malty backbone with toffee and other dark sugars. A bit of funk for complexity, and definite vinous barrel notes present as well. Medium plus, creamy body. Very very good.
